summary:
1. Clone the `advanced-git-exercises` repository from [github.com/nnja/advanced-git-exercises](https://github.com/nnja/advanced-git-exercises).
  2. Checkout the `exercise2` tag to set things up for the following exercise.
  3. Use `git ls-files -s` to view the contents of the staging area.
  4. Make a change and try to stage it interactively (`git add -p`).
  5. Use `git reset` to undo the staging of your file.
  6. Stash your change with a unique stash message, then unstash and apply it back to the `exercise2` branch.
  7. The change you want to stage is listed during the interactive staging process, where it says `+This is a test of the emergency git-casting system.`.
  8. Use `git stash save` with a message; this helps you remember what's what if you stash multiple changes. Then use `git stash apply` to apply the change that was stashed.
